title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 17.8 - Hearing panel; administrative officers
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 17.8 - Hearing panel; administrative officers

State Regulations

Findings of fact, recommendations as to penalties to be
imposed, and any other actions taken by a hearing panel in disciplinary
proceedings, except as hereinafter set forth, shall be made by majority vote. Any determination of guilt shall require a minimum of a four fifths vote of the
hearing panel. An administrative officer, admitted to practice as an attorney
in the State of New York, shall rule on all motions, procedures and other legal
objections, and draft a report which shall reflect the determination and
recommendation of the panel and be subject to the approval of and signature by
the panel chairperson on behalf of the panel. The administrative officer shall
not be entitled to a vote. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
17.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
